revised_title: The Action of Radium Radiations on Blood Components: Hemolysis, Leukocytes, and Complement
tldr: The authors investigate the effects of radium radiations on blood components, including hemolysis of red blood cells, the action on leukocytes, and the impact on opsonin and complement. They find that a-rays cause hemolysis and can destroy leukocytes, while ft- and 7-rays have minimal effects.
